pageContext.claim: “They [the NFL] have rules for everything. You can’t dance in the end zone.”
pageContext.analysis: In May 2017, the National Football League started loosening its restrictions on end-zone celebrations, including on dancing, unsportsmanlike conduct and excessive celebration. NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell changed the rule so that celebrations would be allowed, though prolonged celebrations or ones directed at opponents would still be counted as offensive demonstrations, NPR reported.
